description: Lake Package - Simulates the effects of lakes on the groundwater system by treating each lake as a volume of space within the model grid

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

datasets.description: Number of lakes and output unit

variables.name: NLAKES
variables.tooltip: Total number of separate lakes in the model. Each lake is identified by a unique integer ID.

variables.name: ILKCB
variables.description: Unit number for cell-by-cell lake flow terms. 0=no output, >0=write to this unit.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, lake seepage flow terms saved to binary file. If 0, no cell-by-cell output.

variables.name: STAGES
variables.description: Initial stage (water surface elevation) of the lake (L).
variables.tooltip: Starting water level elevation for each lake. One value per lake. For steady-state, this is the initial estimate.

datasets.description: Lake ID array for each model layer

variables.name: LKARR
variables.description: Lake identification number for each cell. 0=not a lake cell, >0=lake ID number.
variables.tooltip: 2D integer array for each layer. Positive values identify cells as part of a specific lake. 0 indicates a non-lake cell. Read for each layer.

datasets.description: Lakebed leakance for each model layer

variables.name: BDLKNC
variables.description: Lakebed leakance (1/T) for lake-aquifer interface cells. Leakance = K_bed / thickness_bed.
variables.tooltip: 2D array for each layer. Nonzero values at lake boundary cells define the lakebed leakance. 0 for non-lake-boundary cells. Read for each layer.
